pullRequest.body:
Add the converse of the existing `lucas_primality` theorem, and combine them into a `lucas_primality_iff` theorem

Coauthored by @vihdzp 


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

Are there any other changes that you'd like me to make, or is this ready to merge?
I'm not an official Mathlib maintainer, so I can't really make that decision. One of them will have to look at the PR and approve it before it can get merged.
Oh, my bad. Thanks for the review!

Looks good to me, but I'll let another maintainer check too.

:v: Aaron1011 can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11021975437/job/30610265088)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11021975437/job/30610264502)
bors d+
bors d+

This was OK without the space.
```suggestion
```

```suggestion
```
There's a lot of awkward space here, can you reindent the line to fully utilize the 100 characters? (or at least, split it at some point that makes more sense).

```suggestion
such that `a^(p-1) = 1 mod p` and `a^((p-1)/q) ≠ 1 mod p` for all prime factors `q` of `p-1`.
The multiplicative group mod `p` is cyclic, so `a` can be any generator of the group
(which must have order `p-1`).
```

```suggestion
  ⟨reverse_lucas_primality p, fun ⟨a, ⟨ha, hb⟩⟩ ↦ lucas_primality p a ha hb⟩ 
```

Here's a condensed version of your proof:
```suggestion
  have : Fact p.Prime := ⟨hP⟩
  obtain ⟨g, hg⟩ := IsCyclic.exists_generator (α := (ZMod p)ˣ)
  have h1 : orderOf g = p - 1 := by
    rwa [orderOf_generator_eq_natCard hg, Nat.card_eq_fintype_card, ← Nat.prime_iff_card_units]
  have h2 := tsub_pos_iff_lt.2 hP.one_lt
  rw [← orderOf_injective (Units.coeHom _) Units.ext _, orderOf_eq_iff h2] at h1
  refine ⟨g, h1.1, fun q hq hqd ↦ ?_⟩
  replace hq := hq.one_lt
  exact h1.2 _ (Nat.div_lt_self h2 hq) (Nat.div_pos (Nat.le_of_dvd h2 hqd) (zero_lt_one.trans hq))
```
I removed the comments, since I don't think they're as valuable now that the proof is relatively short (and since the docstring already explains the proof anyways). But feel free to add them back if you think they still provide value.

Here's some tips that might be helpful in the future:
- `linarith` is a very powerful tactic, and for that reason, it should be reserved for whenever it's absolutely necessary. Almost all uses in your proof were equivalent to `assumption` (and the remaining one was just `1 < q → 0 < q`, so still overkill).
- There usually isn't much reason to use `trivial`, especially when you can replace it by `assumption` or `exact`.
- When you have multiple goals, you should isolate each using `·` and an indent instead of solving them one after the other.

Thanks for the help - this is much cleaner than what I came up with. I updated your PR to use your version of the proof, and made another simplification from my original (`orderOf_generator_eq_natCard, Nat.card_eq_fintype_card` can be replaced with `orderOf_eq_card_of_forall_mem_zpowers` ).

Since this is such an extensive simplification, I added you as a co-author

```suggestion

/-- A number `p` is prime if and only if there exists an `a` such that
`a^(p-1) = 1 mod p` and `a^((p-1)/q) ≠ 1 mod p` for all prime factors `q` of `p-1`.
-/
```
Missed a period here too.

```suggestion
theorem reverse_lucas_primality (p : ℕ) (hP : p.Prime) :
```
and similarly on line 81

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(NumberTheory): add converse of Lucas test for primes
